skill.name: security-report
skill.description:
Generate security assessment reports in docx format with findings, 
risk ratings, and remediation recommendations.

Use when: User asks for security audit report, vulnerability assessment 
document, penetration test report, or compliance gap analysis document.
Keywords: security report, audit findings, vulnerability report, pentest report
skill.summary:
Generate security assessment reports in docx format with findings, 
risk ratings, and remediation re...
skill.author: BytR-Ecosystems

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond its own files, or external command execution capabilities. The skill provides guidance for generating professional security reports in docx format.

content.value_statement: Security teams spend hours formatting audit reports manually. This skill automates professional security report generation with standardized sections, risk rating colors, and remediation timelines in docx format.
actual_capabilities: Generate docx security assessment reports with standard sections
Apply risk rating color coding (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info)
Create findings tables sorted by severity with CVSS scores
Add executive summaries and remediation roadmaps
Format page breaks and professional document structure
limitations: Does not perform actual security scanning or vulnerability discovery
Does not access external systems or APIs
Does not generate charts or visualizations beyond text formatting
Requires python-docx library for docx file generation

use_cases.title: Pentest Report Generation
use_cases.description: Transform vulnerability scan findings into professionally formatted penetration test reports

use_cases.title: Audit Documentation
use_cases.description: Create compliance gap analysis documents with risk ratings and remediation timelines

use_cases.title: Executive Security Briefings
use_cases.description: Generate C-level security summaries with risk overview and prioritized remediation plans

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a security assessment report for the following findings: [list vulnerabilities with severity]. Include executive summary, detailed findings table, and remediation recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Pentest Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a penetration test report with these findings: [findings]. Use risk rating colors. Include CVSS scores, evidence description, and a 90-day remediation roadmap.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a compliance gap analysis report. Document each requirement, current state, gaps, and remediation steps. Use the standard security report skill format.

prompt_templates.title: Executive Summary Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an executive security summary report. Focus on high-level risk overview, critical findings summary, and prioritized remediation timeline for stakeholder presentation.

output_examples.input: Generate a security report for these vulnerabilities: SQL Injection in login (Critical), XSS in search (High), Missing CSP headers (Medium).
output: Executive Summary: 3 vulnerabilities found (1 Critical, 1 High, 1 Medium)
Finding #1: SQL Injection in Login Module (Critical, CVSS 9.8)
Finding #2: Cross-Site Scripting in Search (High, CVSS 8.1)
Finding #3: Missing Content Security Policy (Medium, CVSS 6.1)
Remediation Roadmap: Critical items within 7 days, High within 30 days

best_practices: Include specific CVSS scores and evidence for each finding to support remediation prioritization
Use executive summaries for stakeholder communication and detailed sections for technical teams
Always include a remediation roadmap with realistic timelines based on severity
anti_patterns: Do not skip the executive summary section when reporting to leadership
Do not omit evidence or references from technical findings
Do not use vague severity ratings without supporting CVSS calculations

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires computer use for docx file generation.

faq.question: What document formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill generates .docx files using the python-docx library. PDF export requires additional conversion.

faq.question: Can I customize the report template?
faq.answer: Yes, you can modify risk colors, section order, and table structures in the skill instructions.

faq.question: Is my data safe when generating reports?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill runs locally with no network calls. All data stays on your machine.

faq.question: Why are my table borders not appearing?
faq.answer: The python-docx library requires setting borders on each cell individually. The skill includes the correct method.

faq.question: How does this compare to other reporting tools?
faq.answer: This skill integrates directly into Claude workflows without requiring separate tools or exports.
